  • Field Details

    • aMovieGridPane

      private javafx.scene.layout.TilePane aMovieGridPane
      The TilePane that serves as a dynamic container for displaying movie cards. Each movie card represents individual movie data and is added to this pane dynamically based on content provided by the MovieService. This pane displays movie cards in a flexible grid-like layout. The number of columns adjusts based on constraints of the pane or viewport width. The movie cards are populated from an associated movie-card-view.fxml file. Each card is loaded with movie-specific data such as title or other attributes. This component is typically updated during initialization or when new movie data is loaded, utilizing methods such as populateGrid.

    • aMovieScrollPane

      private javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane aMovieScrollPane
      ScrollPane used to display movies in the editor view. The content of this ScrollPane is dynamically managed to show a grid of movie cards. Allows users to scroll through the list of movies.

    • aMovies

      private javafx.collections.ObservableList<Movie> aMovies
      Stores a list of Movie objects displayed or managed within the user interface. This observable list dynamically tracks changes to its content and updates the UI components as needed. It is primarily used within the context of the EditorViewController to manage and display a collection of movies.

    • aMovieService

      private final MovieService aMovieService
      Provides a singleton instance of the MovieService for managing movie-related operations within the application. This service is responsible for maintaining an observable list of movies and offers methods to retrieve, add, set, or remove movies from the collection. The instance is initialized using the `MovieService.getInstance()` method to ensure that a single shared instance is utilized throughout the application, maintaining a consistent source of movie data.

    • aUIService

      private final UIService aUIService

    • DEFAULT_COLUMNS

      private static final int DEFAULT_COLUMNS
      Defines the default number of columns used to arrange movie cards in the grid layout within the EditorViewController.

      This value is utilized as a fallback when the column constraints of the GridPane are not explicitly defined or unavailable.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • CARD_TILE_WIDTH

      private static final double CARD_TILE_WIDTH
      Represents the default width of individual movie cards in the movie grid view. This value corresponds to the preferred width defined in the associated FXML file (editor-movie-card-view.fxml) and is used to ensure consistency in the layout of movie cards across the application. It is commonly referenced in calculations for grid adjustment and layout updates in the editor view controller.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • EditorViewController

      public EditorViewController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the editor view when it is first loaded. This method is invoked automatically by the FXML loader. The initialization process involves clearing existing children from the movie grid, setting consistent spacing, padding, and layout configurations for the grid, and preparing it to dynamically adjust column counts based on the viewport's available width. Additionally, a listener is added to the viewport bounds property of the scroll pane to automatically recalculate columns as the viewport size changes. On initialization, the grid is immediately configured with the current viewport width if available. Movies obtained from the service are then populated into the grid by calling the populateGrid method.

    • updateColumnsForWidth

      private void updateColumnsForWidth(double viewportWidth)
      Updates the number of columns in the movie grid based on the available viewport width. Recalculates columns dynamically to optimize layout responsiveness.
      Parameters:
      viewportWidth - the available width of the viewport

    • populateGrid

      private void populateGrid(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Movie> movies)
      Populates the movie grid with a collection of movies. This method clears the existing movie grid content and dynamically generates movie cards for each movie in the provided list. Each card includes actions for editing or removing the movie.

      If the list of movies is null or empty, the grid remains empty.

      Parameters:
      movies - the list of movies to populate the grid with. Each movie in the list is rendered as a card in the grid. If null or empty, no cards will be displayed.

    • onAddMovieButtonClick

      private void onAddMovieButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the "Add Movie" button click event. Opens a modal dialog for adding a new movie.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the button

    • onShowroomsViewButtonClick

      private void onShowroomsViewButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the "Showrooms View" button click event. Opens the showrooms view in a new window.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the button

    • onStatsViewButtonClick

      private void onStatsViewButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the "Stats View" button click event. Opens the statistics view in a new window.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the button

    • switchView

      private void switchView(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent, String pFileName)
      Switches the current view to the view specified by the provided FXML file path. The method loads the specified FXML file, sets it as the scene for the current stage, and displays the updated stage.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the ActionEvent that triggered the view switch. Used to retrieve the current stage from the pEvent source.
      pFileName - the path to the FXML file that defines the new view to be loaded. It should be a valid path within the application's resources.

    • onSignOutButtonClick

      private void onSignOutButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the sign out button click event. Opens the login view and closes the current window.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the sign out button
